flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=35>>35 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 35 years x 2 = <<35*2=70>>70 years old.
This means, Tully is 70 years - 3 years = <<70-3=67>>67 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 67 years - 1 year = 66 years old last year.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 35. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
